description: Oral land sale with substantial partial performance
facts: Oliver orally agreed to sell his farm to Patricia for $400,000
Patricia paid the full purchase price
Patricia took possession of the land and made $50,000 in improvements
Oliver now refuses to transfer the deed, claiming no written contract exists
asp_facts: contract(c8). subject_matter(c8, land). parties(c8, oliver, patricia). has_writing(c8, no). sale_amount(c8, 400000). payment_made(c8, full). possession_taken(c8, yes). improvements_made(c8, yes). improvement_value(c8, 50000).
question: Is this contract enforceable despite lacking a writing?
rationale: The doctrine of partial performance creates an exception to the Statute of Frauds for land contracts. Payment, possession, and improvements are sufficient acts of partial performance to make the oral contract enforceable.
